items.title: Rename index.md to index.mdaaronmcrae

items.content_html:
Description

The warning on -webkit-scrollbar is currently a bit misleading - it makes it sound as if the scrollbar-color and scrollbar-width methods have more support, when in fact they have far less - only Firefox supports them. This edit attempts to make that clearer.

Motivation

I think it's important that users don't mistakenly use the scrollbar-width, scrollbar-color methods thinking they have broader support, when in fact they have far less. I think it's also important that MDN appear impartial, and not appear to favor Firefox by implying that something only Firefox supports is standard.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Updating warning around -webkit-scroll

items.content_html:
Intro and outline for the intro level tutorial.

items.title: DRAFT: PWA: intro to basic tutorial

items.content_html:
Description

Add install/uninstall overview confirmed to work for Ubuntu PWA.

Motivation

Happy for others to see if it works in earlier browser versions than v111, or earlier operating systems, or is otherwise confirmed to be supported upstream by those systems/browser vendors. I just put down my test setup right now (Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS, Brave 111/Edge 111) since I can verify it worked for me.

Additional details

I started looking as this is the route Microsoft Teams on Linux has gone down, so that's at least one major vendor now supporting the PWA experience: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-progressive-web-app-now-available-on-linux/ba-p/3669846

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add install/uninstall overview for Ubuntu PWA

items.content_html:
Description

ScrollBehavior has three possible values ("auto", "instant" and "smooth"), but only two are presented ("auto", and "smooth"), this commit adds the third one.

Motivation

Make all allowed values presented.

Additional details

Page that already has the same info: Element.scrollTo

https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom-view/#enumdef-scrollbehavior
items.title: Add missing 'instant' scroll behavior option value

items.content_html:
Description

Update link syntax for web/api/window/opener

Motivation

The markdown link syntax was visible and it was not a link in two places. This change fixes up the syntax such that the markdown syntax is no longer visible and the links are clickable.
items.title: Update link syntax for web/api/window/opener

items.content_html:
Description

This PR syncs the "Values" and "Description" sections of padding-block-* and padding-inline* with those of inset-*, margin-* (logical) and padding-block.

Motivation

For consistency among the contents of logical property pages. Also, the existing "Values" and "Description" sections of the mentioned properties don't seem to do a better work than the simple ones of other logical properties.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Sync the contents of logical `padding` properties with other logical properties

items.content_html:
FF112 permanently removes IDBMutableFile, IDBFileRequest, IDBFileHandle, IDBDatabase.createMutableFile() from FF in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1500343

This adds a release note.

Related docs work can be tracked in #25360
items.title: FF112 Relnote: Remove IDBMutableFile and friends

items.content_html:
Description

Added a note about cursor behavior on iPadOS. iPad supports pointer and text only, other values do not change an appearance of the pointer.

Motivation

This information may be useful for people who rely on cursor property only when designing a hover state of elements.

Additional details

Official video from Apple demonstrating the new cursor: https://youtu.be/78m5qtJI5Nk
items.title: Add a note about `cursor` behavior on iPadOS

items.content_html:
Description

This PR makes two minor changes to the tabs/executeScript and scripting/executeScript webextensions API docs.

  1. fix issue note in scripting/executescript
  2. Mention special cases where executeScript does not work even with host permissions: reader view, view-source, and PDF viewer pages.

Motivation

Document current special case behavior, that executeScript will not function on reader view, view-source, and PDF viewer pages, even with host permissions allowed.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: WebExtensions: note special cases for `executeScript`
